ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to paint! Best class ever. If you've never painted it absolutely does not matter  Matt and Brianna are the best take this class.
This course taught me how to paint, which involves so much trial and error. I also learned the chemistry makeup of oil paints and why people use solvents to dilute the paints.

Knowledge: improving composition and varying technique to obtain different textures and atmospheres. Skills/insights: working with oil paint for both short for and long form projects, planning out self driven projects, working with live models.
I learned how to view the world through a different lens and how to depict it using a new medium -- and I think I really improved in my painting skills (which were zero, to begin with)
I learned the basics of painting and how to use oil paints, different substrates and brush techniques for my art.
Basic painting technical skills and evaluation.
The ability to talk about, understand, and appreciate art made from peers and in general.
Learned basic oil painting skills
How to paint!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: How safe it was to learn how to paint despite never knowing how to paint  classmates were supportive and so were Matt/Brianna

Strengths: An amazing professor that gives you space and guidance to grow, amazing peers to learn from their techniques in color manipulation and brush strokes
Weaknesses: None!

The design of this course is optimal for student learning. As much time as possible is spent painting, instructors walk around during these long painting sessions to provide advice and to converse about the direction of each student's work. Long stretches of working on pieces are broken up with critiques which are good for taking a step back and trying to figure out how one can improve their work. 

That being said, my main complaint with this course is that people are scared to give negative feedback with critiques. Classmates often feel uncomfortable genuinely "critiquing" other's work and instead resort to a stream of compliments that do not prove to be entirely useful for understanding how you can improve. While the instructors often balanced this out with thoughtful criticism, I would have appreciated if the instructors emphasized and described at the beginning of the course how students can respectfully and effectively give constructive criticisms. I think my work and the work of my classmates would have benefited from this.
Maybe a few more demos would be helpful, but overall a great course
I love how the course was guided in terms of what to paint and enjoyed the different projects given.
Great structure, lots of time to work on projects. A bit more funding would be nice.
Best course ever
A lot of freedom to explore, which is awesome, but you have to ask for it if you want instruction / guidance

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes
I would recommend this course to another student who also wants to learn how to use oil paints and improve on their skills as an artist.

I would certainly recommend Painting Basics to another student. I found it to be a very approachable introduction to painting and the use of a medium as complex as oil paints. As someone who had experience painting before the class, I still found the lessons, feedback, and guidance to be very specialized and helpful.
Yes! One of my favorite courses at Yale
Yes! Amazing class either for majors or to fulfill a distributional.
Absolutely. This class was by far my favorite class Ive ever taken at Yale! you will learn so much so quickly. SO GOOD
Yes. Great senior spring course.
Absolutely. A must take art class if you have the slightest interest in (oil) painting.
Yes!
Absolutely!!! Worth it to take. Skill that you have for life
Absolutely, great senior spring course! Learned a new skill and got to work with my hands in class for once.
